metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16993 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In phpBB before 3.1.7-PL1, includes/acp/acp_bbcodes.php has improper verification of a CSRF token on the BBCode page in the Administration Control Panel. An actual CSRF attack is possible if an attacker also manages to retrieve the session id of a reauthenticated administrator prior to targeting them. It was discovered that phpBB has a CSRF vulnerability. An attacker could use it to retrieve the session id and gain access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16993` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpbb3 - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
phpbb3-l10n - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpbb3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
